page.title: 12Finningley village
page.content:
The {Village Hall:
The building which is now the {village {hall}was previously used as the village school.In 1855 John Harvey Esq. donated Â£20 annually to establish a church school.This remained in use until 1966 when a new school was built.The village hall is now used for youth club and playschool.
The {Village Green:}
The village green had a huge oak tree in its centre.In 1981 this became diseased and had to be felled.The pond was once bigger than it is today,and contained a 'piggy pole'to which wrong doers were tied as a punishment.The village has two inns, 'The Harvey Arms',and the 'Horse and Stag'.
